definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: If heaven is a million years away, oh just call me and I make your day.
sentences.chinese: 纵使路途遥远千年万年，我也必定将你带入那片天堂。

sentences.english: Even if a long journey, I will follow the love you left, Keep on moving.
sentences.chinese: 即使路途遥远，俺也会跟随着你留下地爱，继续前行。

sentences.english: He faced the long drive home with dread.
sentences.chinese: 回家的路途遥远，他心里有些害怕。

sentences.english: It's far; hundreds and hundreds of kilometers.
The distance with not feeling well, go home easier said than done.
sentences.chinese: 路途遥远加上身体不适，回家谈何容易。

sentences.english: Therefore, I think it should not travel by train if it's far.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我觉得路途遥远的话就不要坐火车旅行。

sentences.english: The clothes and sandals that we use have worn out because of the very long journey.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们的衣服和鞋，为了路途遥远，都穿烂了。

definition: to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
to travel over land and water (idiom)
(adverbial phrase used with verbs such as 歸|归[gui1] or 赴[fu4] etc) traveling a great distance
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
